<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_create_response_from_buffer:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN struct MHD_Response *
MHD_create_response_from_buffer (size_t size,
                                 void *buffer,
                                 enum MHD_ResponseMemoryMode mode)
{
  if (MHD_RESPMEM_MUST_FREE == mode)
    return MHD_create_response_from_buffer_with_free_callback_cls (size,
                                                                   buffer,
                                                                   &free,
                                                                   buffer);
  if (MHD_RESPMEM_MUST_COPY == mode)
    return MHD_create_response_from_buffer_copy (size,
                                                 buffer);

  return MHD_create_response_from_buffer_with_free_callback_cls (size,
                                                                 buffer,
                                                                 NULL,
                                                                 NULL);
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: There is no direct self-call to MHD_create_response_from_buffer in the provided code, so no direct recursion is present. The only code locations that could lead to indirect recursion are the three return statements that invoke other functions; those calls must be inspected to determine whether those other functions (or functions they call) call back to MHD_create_response_from_buffer. Other fragments — the function signature, the enum equality checks (MHD_RESPMEM_MUST_FREE / MHD_RESPMEM_MUST_COPY), the if/return control flow, and the use of &free as a callback pointer — do not by themselves create direct or indirect self-calls and therefore need not be further investigated for Rule 17.2 based on this snippet alone.
